title.native: 小林さんちのメイドラゴンＳミニドラ
title.romaji: Kobayashi-san Chi no Maidragon S: Mini Dra
title.english: Miss Kobayashi's Dragon Maid S: Miniature Dragon

description:
Short animations streamed on Kyoto Animation's YouTube channel in the lead up to the July 7 premiere of the second season.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

Note: This entry's total count includes episodes 1-13 + the 3 SP episodes that released during the second season's run.
synonyms: Miss Kobayashi's Dragon Maid S Broadcast Commemoration Short Anime Theater Series
Miss Kobayashi's Dragon Maid S Short Animation Series

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Cosplay
tags.description: Features dressing up as a different character or profession.

tags.name: Office Lady
tags.description: Prominently features a female office worker or OL.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Swimming
tags.description: Centers around the sport of swimming.

title.native: 小林さんちのメイドラゴンＳ
小林さんちのメイドラゴンＳミニドラEX

node.description:
Yasuhiro Takemoto studied animation at the Yoyogi Animation Academy. After graduating, he started working at [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/Kyoto-Animation) for almost his entire animation career, joining the company in 1996. At the company, Yasuhiro was considered one of the most reliable and trustworthy members of the staff. [Nurse Witch Komugi](https://anilist.co/anime/615/Nurse-Witch-Komugichan/) was his directorial debut​ and [Full Metal Panic? Fumoffu](https://anilist.co/anime/72/Full-Metal-Panic-Fumoffu/) his first solo directorial debut.

He died in the arson attack at Kyoto Animation's Studio 1 on July 18, 2019.
Animator and character designer affiliated with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/)
Changed their family name to Okamura in 2015.

Yasuhiro Takemoto studied animation at the Yoyogi Animation Academy. After graduating, he started working at [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/Kyoto-Animation) for almost his entire animation career, joining the company in 1996. At the company, Yasuhiro was considered one of the most reliable and trustworthy members of the staff. [Nurse Witch Komugi](https://anilist.co/anime/615/Nurse-Witch-Komugichan/) was his directorial debut​ and [Full Metal Panic? Fumoffu](https://anilist.co/anime/72/Full-Metal-Panic-Fumoffu/) his first solo directorial debut.

He died in the arson attack at Kyoto Animation's Studio 1 on July 18, 2019.
_Note: Not to be confused with [横山友紀](https://anilist.co/staff/191535/Yuki-Yokoyama)._

streamingEpisodes.title: Episode 1 - The Strongest Maid in History, Tohru! (Well, She is a Dragon)
Episode 2 - Second Dragon, Kanna! (We're Totally Spoiling Here)
Episode 3 - Start of a New Life! (That Doesn't Go Well, Of Course)
Episode 4 - Kanna Goes to School! (Not that she needs to.)
Episode 5 - Tohru's Real World Lessons! (She thinks she understands it already.)
Episode 6 - Home Visit! (And Homes Not Visited)
Episode 7 - Summer's Staples! (The Fanservice Episode, Frankly)
Episode 8 - New Dragon, Elma! (She's Finally Appearing, Huh?)
Episode 9 - Sports Festival! (There's No Twist Or Anything)
Episode 10 - Troupe Dragon, On Stage! (They Had A Troupe Name, Huh)
Episode 11 - Year End, New Year! (No Comiket Bit This Time)
Episode 12 - Tohru and Kobayashi's Impactful Meeting! (We're Raising the Bar on Ourselves)
Episode 13 - Emperor of Demise Arrives! (It Was the Final Episode Before We Knew It)
